FOUND IN: Barra (the southernmost of the inhabited islands in the group)

CLUE: Lie with arms and legs spread about loosely

FOUND IN: Cutting-edge - At the forefront or leading edge of technology, development, etc., as in "cutting-edge research."

CLUE: Least in difference between high and low tides
FOUND IN: Neap tides occur because the gravitational forces from the sun and the moon are perpendicular to one another, reducing their combined effect on Earth's oceans.
Meadow (5 letters) - A field dominated by wild vegetation; often found in rural landscapes.
Ampere (unit of current) - The term is derived from André-Marie Ampère's name, who studied electricity and magnetism.
